item.title: Contestants face buckets of insects to gain entry to the Jungle Arms - Independent.ie
item.description:
Contestants face buckets of insects to gain entry to the Jungle Arms  Independent.ie

The seven remaining I’m A Celebrity contestants faced buckets of insects to gain entry to the Jungle Arms, the reality show’s own make-shift pub. Following last night’s departure of EastEnders actress Rita Simons, the camp-members were rewarded with snacks, drinks and karaoke. A fixture from previous series, entry to the Jungle Arms was not guaranteed and the remaining celebrities were forced to complete a challenge before walking through the door. The seven remaining contestants take their seats at the Jungle Arms (ITV/REX/Shutterstock) After a day which saw John Barrowman rescued from a c...

Khan was the third celebrity to leave after Noel Edmonds and Malique Thompson-Dwyer. .@SairKhan's time in the Jungle has come to an end! #ImACeleb pic.twitter.com/qfebUGMU3E — I'm A Celebrity... (@imacelebrity) December 3, 2018 Speaking to hosts Declan Donnelly and Holly Willoughby afterwards, Khan said it felt odd to be outside after 17 days in the jungle. She said her fellow contestants were “a laugh a m...

item.title: Tension in the I’m A Celebrity jungle as campers row over rice - Independent.ie
item.description:
Tension in the I’m A Celebrity jungle as campers row over rice  Independent.ie

Tensions flared in the I’m A Celebrity jungle as the campers disagreed over their food rations. Things got heated when actress Rita Simons challenged camp chef John Barrowman over the amount of rice he was cooking for lunch. Barrowman was boiling up four portions but Simons felt it was not enough. “Hands up who wants more rice because I do, put your hands up if you want more, it’s too much to squirrel away, and it’s ridiculous,” she said. “That’s not enough for 11 of us. “Everyone’s too scared to speak up about it so I do in a jokey passive aggressive way,” she said later in the Bush Telegr...

item.title: I’m A Celeb stars minus Nick Knowles enjoy feast after successful trial - Independent.ie
item.description:
I’m A Celeb stars minus Nick Knowles enjoy feast after successful trial  Independent.ie

Nick Knowles sacrificed his share of food to allow his fellow I’m A Celebrity contestants to enjoy a luxury meal. The DIY SOS host insisted the rest of the team eat without him after ex-EastEnders star Rita Simons, Torchwood actor John Barrowman and The Vamps singer James McVey failed to grab all 11 flags during a Bushtucker Trial. The trio had collected 10 when Barrowman came agonisingly close to grabbing the final flag and ensuring everyone sat down to a roast dinner. During Monday’s episode, he offered to be the one to miss out but Knowles won the argument and watched as the other stars ...

item.title: I’m a Celebrity 2018 lineup: Full list of contestants, from Noel Edmonds to Harry Redknapp - The Independent
item.description:
I’m a Celebrity 2018 lineup: Full list of contestants, from Noel Edmonds to Harry Redknapp  The Independent

I’m a Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here is back, with a new raft of famous faces entering the jungle. Football manager Harry Redknapp, Torchwood star John Barrowman and X Factor favourite Fleur East lead this year’s contestants, with Noel Edmonds joining the intrepid adventurers (for a reported £500,000 payday) as the series' final contestant. James McVey, who found fame as part of boy band The Vamps, also appears on the show, alongside soap stars Sair Khan (Coronation Street), Rita Simons (EastEnders) and Malique Thompson-Dwyer (Hollyoaks). Who else features? You can see all eleven of this y...

item.title: Roxy Mitchell actress, Rita Simons, reveals why she's leaving EastEnders - Her.ie
item.description:
Roxy Mitchell actress, Rita Simons, reveals why she's leaving EastEnders  Her.ie

Rumours have been circulating around the an upcoming shock exit forRoxy and Ronnie Mitchell from EastEnders for months. It was reported earlier this year that the pair were going to be killed off in dramatic scenes to tie in with Ronnies wedding to Jack Branning. Now the actress who plays Roxy Mitchell, Rita Simons, has shed some light on why she's about to leave the soap. Speaking to theHerts & Essex Observerthe actress opened up about her upcoming exit saying: "It was mutual, for a start, so you know, I wanted to go. A new boss came in, he wanted us to go, which we were all happy with. "I...

item.title: Details have been revealed about how Roxy and Ronnie Mitchell will be killed on EastEnders - Her.ie
item.description:
Details have been revealed about how Roxy and Ronnie Mitchell will be killed on EastEnders  Her.ie

Massive spoilers below. By now we all probably know that Ronnie and Roxy Mitchell are set to be killed off from EastEnders. It was confirmed by The Sun that the two actresses, Samantha Womack and Rita Simons, would be leaving the show after their deaths in the New Year's Eve episode. A sourcetold Digital Spy, "Alongside Samantha, Rita was recently offered to take part in the same big storyline that will see the Mitchell sisters depart Walford, but we will not be releasing any further details at this time. We wish Rita all the best for the future." But while it was confirmed they would be le...

item.title: I’m A Celebrity returns with Holly Willoughby and record viewing figures - Independent.ie
item.description:
I’m A Celebrity returns with Holly Willoughby and record viewing figures  Independent.ie

Holly Willoughby has proven to be a lucky charm for I’m A Celebrity … Get Me Out Of Here! with the show enjoying its most-watched launch since 2013. Some 11 million people tuned in for the first episode – up 700,000 on last year, according to overnight ratings. Looks like @Redknapp DEFINITELY wasn't lying when he said he'd never seen #ImACeleb before 😱@ImACelebrity pic.twitter.com/IBUVZ7qm6d — ITV (@ITV) November 18, 2018 It was the biggest overnight audience for any channel so far this year, excluding the World Cup, according to ITV. It was also the fourth-largest audience for the launch ...

item.title: Autistic boy writes letter to Anne Hegerty calling her an inspiration - The Independent
item.description:
Autistic boy writes letter to Anne Hegerty calling her an inspiration  The Independent

A schoolboy's heartfelt letter to I'm A Celebrity contestant Anne Hegerty about their shared experience of autism has received thousands of shares online. Joseph Hughes, 11, from Preston, was diagnosed with autism at the age of five. According to his mother, Kate Jarvis, 31, he "has quite a few struggles, especially socially, but he's a lovely little boy". Ms Jarvis said Joseph was "amazed" at seeing Hegerty, who has Asperger's syndrome, as The Governess on ITV gameshow The Chase. "He sees his autism quite negatively sometimes, so was pleased to see someone with autism doing something like ...

item.title: Rita Simons just made her feelings about EastEnders very clear following her departure from the show - Her.ie
item.description:
Rita Simons just made her feelings about EastEnders very clear following her departure from the show  Her.ie

Ohh, not a fan then. Rita Simons played the iconic Roxy Mitchell on EastEnders for ten years. Her partner in crime was her on screen sister Ronnie played by Samantha Womack. Viewers of the show were shocked and heartbroken this month when the duo were killed off in very questionable circumstances. The desperation of the fans seems to have failed to translate to Walford where no one seems overly concerned about the sisters passing. Simons took to Twitter to make her feelings clear. Don't watch Enders anymore so forgive me if I'm misinformed. But from what I hear..is ANYONE mourning Roxy on t...

item.title: The EastEnders teaser for the New Year's episode has everyone in tears - Her.ie
item.description:
The EastEnders teaser for the New Year's episode has everyone in tears  Her.ie

The teaser for the New Years Eve episode for EastEnders has been released. We all knew the day was coming when the Mitchell sisters would leave Albert Square, but we still don't know for sure how it will happen. Ronnie and Roxy Mitchell are central to the teaser for the very last episode of 2016 and it has everyone in tears as they are set to leave the show. We'd heard before that their exit would coincide with Ronnie's wedding to Jack Branning and would see the two girls drowning during the evening celebrations but there's no hint at this ending from the trailer. The girls can be seen havi...

item.description:

As Mollie King becomes the first confirmed contestant for the Strictly Come Dancing 2017 line-up, here are some of the stars rumoured to be joining her… Anne Robinson The Weakest Link star, 72, has been tipped to bring her piercing glare to the Strictly dance floor, in a role that would coincide with her reported plans to feature on a Children In Need comeback special of her popular quiz show. Samantha Womack Womack has been tipped for a return to BBC One after her EastEnders character, Ronnie Mitchell, was killed off on her wedding day earlier this year. Rita Simons, who played her on-scre...

item.title: Ex-EastEnders star Rita Simons: That chapter in my life is shut - Independent.ie
item.description:
Ex-EastEnders star Rita Simons: That chapter in my life is shut  Independent.ie

Ex-EastEnders star Rita Simons has said she stopped watching the BBC One soap because it became “unhealthy”. Simons, 40, played Albert Square’s Roxy Mitchell for 10 years before her character and her screen sister Ronnie (Samantha Womack) drowned in a swimming pool and were killed off. Simons, who has swapped Walford for a star role in Legally Blonde The Musical, told the Press Association: “The last time I watched EastEnders I died, which was kind of traumatic. “I believe in the law of attraction, that if you get too involved in stuff it will come to you, and there was something slightly d...

item.title: Last night's EastEnders had everyone in tears and brought an end to Ronnie and Roxy - Her.ie
item.description:
Last night's EastEnders had everyone in tears and brought an end to Ronnie and Roxy  Her.ie

It's the end of an era. The EastEnders episode we were all waiting for was finally aired last night. We'd been teased for months that the very final episode of 2016 would see the end of two of the most popular characters, Roxy and Ronnie Mitchell. We had heard rumours that it was going to happen on the night of Ronnie's wedding and had something to do with a swimming pool and that's exactly what happened. Ronnie and Roxy were having a celebratory drink by the pool while Ronnie's new husband, Jack, was reading a bedtime story to the kids. While he read out some pages from Cinderella Roxy div...

item.title: EastEnders plans shock disaster storyline next week... more fan favourites to be killed off? - Independent.ie
item.description:
EastEnders plans shock disaster storyline next week... more fan favourites to be killed off?  Independent.ie

Show bosses have revealed that a huge disaster storyline is planned for next week. The epic storyline will take place from Monday, January 23 and sees Walford thrown into chaos, following a shock disaster. The drama kicks off when news breaks that the council is planning to visit the market. A furious Martin Folwer rallies the traders to stage an all-out strike but the fear of losing out on money is too great and they refuse his proposal. As the residents carry on with their day, disaster strikes. Tuesday's episode will deal with the aftermath of the shock event but show bosses are keeping ...

item.title: I'm a Celebrity: Noel Edmonds officially unveiled as final contestant to enter jungle - The Independent
item.description:
I'm a Celebrity: Noel Edmonds officially unveiled as final contestant to enter jungle  The Independent

After a week of rumours, ITV has officially announced that Noel Edmonds is heading into the I'm A Celebrity jungle. The former host of Deal Or No Deal will join stars including football manager Harry Redknapp, The Chase star Anne Hegerty and actress Emily Atack. "Time to really get this party started! Noel Edmonds is coming to the Jungle!" read a Tweet from the I'm A Celebrity Twitter account on Tuesday (20 November). Time to really get this party started! Noel Edmonds is coming to the Jungle! #ImACeleb pic.twitter.com/dGjIsTegT9 — I'm A Celebrity... (@imacelebrity) 21 November 2018 The pos...

item.title: Ronnie and Roxy Mitchell's deaths upset me, says EastEnders' former producer - Independent.ie
item.description:
Ronnie and Roxy Mitchell's deaths upset me, says EastEnders' former producer  Independent.ie

Former EastEnders producer Dominic Treadwell-Collins has said he was upset when the soap’s new boss killed off the Mitchell sisters. Archers editor Sean O’Connor took over the BBC programme when Dominic left last year, making his mark by recasting Michelle Fowler and killing off Ronnie and Roxy Mitchell (Samantha Womack and Rita Simons) in a dramatic pool scene. Dominic, 39, told Radio Times it was hard seeing the changes, because watching somebody else dictate what happens to the characters was like watching someone else raise your children. He said: “The deaths of Ronnie and Roxy made me ...

item.title: EastEnders 'plots gruesome exit' for Mitchell sisters - RTÉ News
item.description:
EastEnders 'plots gruesome exit' for Mitchell sisters  RTÉ News

EastEnders fans have been left reeling by reports that two of the soap's iconic characters, Ronnie and Roxy Mitchell, will meet a "gruesome end" in their exit storyline. Warning: spoiler alert! British tabloid The Sun claims that while the soap's producers have talked about filming different endings in a bid to keep the actual storyline a secret, Ronnie and Roxy - played by Samantha Womack and Rita Simons - will meet "a watery death" in a swimming pool. Rita Simons and Samantha Womack joined the soap in 2007 A source told the paper: "From the minute it was revealed they were leaving, and ev...

item.title: Rita Simons 'had to' get out of EastEnders - RTÉ News
item.description:
Rita Simons 'had to' get out of EastEnders  RTÉ News

Rita Simons has spoken about her shock decision to leave EastEnders after a decade on the show, saying she "had to get out of there". Simons and her co-star Samantha Womack have had a long-running stint on the BBC soap as the Mitchell sisters Roxy and Ronnie and are set to exit the show after a heartbreaking storyline plays out over the festive period. The 39-year-old actress told the Herts & Essex Observer that she is was ready for a new challenge, saying: "It was mutual, for a start, so you know, I wanted to go. A new boss came in, he wanted us to go, which we were all happy with. "I had ...

item.title: EastEnders' Jack faces the heartbreak of goodbye - RTÉ News
item.description:
EastEnders' Jack faces the heartbreak of goodbye  RTÉ News

EastEnders fans are set for heart-rending scenes on Monday night as Jack Branning prepares to say goodbye to stepson Matthew. The widower, played by Scott Maslen, has been struggling to look after Matthew since the death of wife Ronnie (Samantha Womack) at their New Year wedding. Jack's wife Ronnie (Samantha Womack, front) and sister-in-law Roxy (Rita Simons, driving) died in EastEnders' New Year tearjerker Matthew's biological father Charlie Cotton (Declan Bennett) has returned to Albert Square, seeking to bring Matthew to live with him in Ireland. Heart. Breaking. ?? Has Jack done the rig...

item.title: Rita Simons reveals obsessive compulsive disorder diagnosis - Independent.ie
item.description:
Rita Simons reveals obsessive compulsive disorder diagnosis  Independent.ie

Rita Simons opens up about her obsessive compulsive disorder (OCD) diagnosis as she gets to know her campmates on I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here! The former EastEnders star confides in The Chase’s Anne Hegerty in scenes due to air in Monday night’s instalment of the ITV show. She revealed her own struggle after a discussion about Hegerty having Asperger syndrome. “You know that I’m fully diagnosed OCD… I’m much better now,” Simons says. Anne Hegerty (Ian West/PA) Singer Fleur East asks Simons how she can cope with jungle life, and the actress replies: “I’m not too bad with cleanliness ...

item.title: Noel Edmonds officially announced as I'm A Celebrity contestant - The Telegraph
item.description:
Noel Edmonds officially announced as I'm A Celebrity contestant  The Telegraph

Noel Edmonds has officially been announced as an I'm A Celebrity contestant. The 69-year-old former host of Deal Or No Deal and Noel's House Party will enter the Australian jungle to join stars including football manager Harry Redknapp, quiz expert Anne Hegerty and actress Emily Atack. Edmonds's arrival had been rumoured and was confirmed by the official I'm A Celebrity Twitter account on Tuesday. The tweet said: "Time to really get this party started! Noel Edmonds is coming to the Jungle!" The post, which described Edmonds as a "TV legend", listed his phobias as heights and confined spaces...

item.title: I'm a Celebrity: Anne Hegerty praised by autism charity for talking about her diagnosis on ITV show - The Independent
item.description:
I'm a Celebrity: Anne Hegerty praised by autism charity for talking about her diagnosis on ITV show  The Independent

Anne Hegerty has been praised by an autism charity for appearing on I’m A Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here! Best known for appearing as “The Governess” on The Chase, Hegerty has spoken candidly about her experience with Asperger’s syndrome – a condition that can affect a person’s social interactions, communication, interests and behaviour – on the the ITV series. “We’ve loved seeing the outpouring of support for Anne Hegerty. We hope this will be the start of better representation of autistic women in the media and help everyone understand the diversity of autism,” a statement from the Natio...

item.title: I'm a Celebrity 2018 launch named most-watched TV show of the year so far outside of football matches - The Independent
item.description:
I'm a Celebrity 2018 launch named most-watched TV show of the year so far outside of football matches  The Independent

This year’s I’m A Celebrity opening episode was a massive success for ITV, becoming the most-watched episode of television this year. According to overnight ratings, an average 11 million people watched the first episode, the audience peaking at 11.6 million with a total 51 per cent viewer share. The episode saw off competition from continuing drama The Little Drummer Girl on BBC One and Louis Theroux’s Altered States on BBC Two. That figure is 700,000 more than who watched last year’s launch and the series’ most-watched opening since 2013. ITV claims the launch is the most-watched broadcas...

item.title: I'm A Celebrity... salaries reveal huge pay gap in the jungle - The Telegraph
item.description:
I'm A Celebrity... salaries reveal huge pay gap in the jungle  The Telegraph

The salaries of ITV’s survival reality series I’m a Celebrity have reportedly been uncovered, revealing the television channel shelled out a pretty penny to secure the cast of the 18th series. According to celebrity PR guru Ed Hopkins, it is estimated television presenter and late arrival Noel Edmonds landed the biggest payday with £600,000 and broke the series’s record when it came to fees. Football manager Harry Redknapp scored the second highest with an estimated £500,000, while DIY SOS presenter Nick Knowles will reportedly earn £200,000. Actor John Barrowman, who has been pursued by th...

item.title: Soggy start for I’m A Celebrity’s 10 new stars as storm strikes - Independent.ie
item.description:
Soggy start for I’m A Celebrity’s 10 new stars as storm strikes  Independent.ie

The new series of I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here! gets off to a wet and windy start as a huge storm hits the jungle before the stars arrive. The show will begin on Sunday evening with 10 new stars including football boss Harry Redknapp, actor John Barrowman and former EastEnders actress Rita Simons preparing to knuckle down in tough living conditions. Things will be even more uncomfortable due to the bad weather, which flooded the show’s Croc Creek and Snake Rock camps, soaking all utensils and sleeping areas. REVEALED: Our 2018 Campmates! ⭐ The Jungle fun begins Sunday at 9pm on @itv ...

item.title: I'm a Celebrity: the full lineup - Noel Edmonds rumoured to join Harry Redknapp, with Holly Willoughby hosting - The Telegraph
item.description:
I'm a Celebrity: the full lineup - Noel Edmonds rumoured to join Harry Redknapp, with Holly Willoughby hosting  The Telegraph

The former Deal Or No Deal presenter is reportedly set to join football manager Harry Redknapp, The Chase's Anne Hegerty and actor John Barrowman in Australia for the new series of I'm A Celebrity... Get Me Out Of Here! The former host of Noel's House Party will be one of the biggest names on the ITV show, fronted by Declan Donnelly and this year Holly Willoughby. He will join DIY SOS host Nick Knowles, pop stars James McVey of The Vamps and Fleur East, former EastEnders star Rita Simons, Coronation Street actress Sair Khan, Inbetweeners actress Emily Atack and Hollyoaks actor Malique Thomp...

item.title: Full I'm a Celebrity line-up confirmed: time to rumble in the jungle - The Telegraph
item.description:
Full I'm a Celebrity line-up confirmed: time to rumble in the jungle  The Telegraph

The lineup for the 18th series of ITV's I'm a Celebrity has been confirmed, further stoking the flames of anticipation for the long-running survival reality series. I'm a Celebrity is one of ITV's most popular productions and usually runs for three weeks, bringing in millions of viewers. The 17th series' was watched by an average of 10.3m viewers, with a peak of 11.2m and an audience share of 46 per cent for its premiere episode, giving the channel its highest overnight ratings of the year. The stars bound for the Australian jungle are: Rita SimonsRita SimonsCredit: Female First Simons is a...

item.title: Maggot-eating and weeping in hammocks: what to expect from 2018’s I’m a Celebrity - The Guardian
item.description:
Maggot-eating and weeping in hammocks: what to expect from 2018’s I’m a Celebrity  The Guardian

Yes, I’m a Celebrity Get Me Out of Here! (Sunday, 9pm, ITV) is back for an 18th – 18th! – series of C-listers hungrily blubbing in hammocks. You know what to expect by now. But in case you’ve forgotten … Recognition The beauty of I’m a Celeb is that it is the exact same show, year after year, without any deviation, slowly bobbing into view in the late autumn/early winter to herald the change of seasons with footage of a soap star plunging their head into worm mucus. The only mild change this year is the temporary substitution of host Holly Willoughby for Ant McPartlin, which will be disorie...

item.title: Harry Redknapp to join John Barrowman, Rita Simons and more in I’m A Celebrity - Independent.ie
item.description:
Harry Redknapp to join John Barrowman, Rita Simons and more in I’m A Celebrity  Independent.ie

Harry Redknapp will head into the jungle for the new series of I’m A Celebrity… Get Me Out Of Here! despite never having seen the programme before. The football manager, 71, is among the 10 stars confirmed for the ITV series, which will this year be hosted by Declan Donnelly and Holly Willoughby. He will join DIY SOS host Nick Knowles, actor and entertainer John Barrowman, pop stars James McVey of The Vamps and Fleur East, former EastEnders star Rita Simons, Coronation Street actress Sair Khan, The Chase’s Anne Hegerty, Inbetweeners actress Emily Atack and Hollyoaks actor Malique Thompson-D...

item.title: Deal or No Deal. Noel Edmonds linked to I'm a Celeb - RTÉ News
item.description:
Deal or No Deal. Noel Edmonds linked to I'm a Celeb  RTÉ News

It has been reported that Deal or No Deal host Noel Edmonds will be the surprise eleventh contestant on this year's I'm a Celebrity... Get Me Out of Here! when the show returns this weekend. British tabloid The Sun claims the 69-year-old television legend has secured one of the biggest fees in the show's history - reportedly over £500,000 - to take part in the reality TV series. "Producers are talking about Noel as one of their best signings ever," a source told The Sun. "Bosses think he'll have loads of stories to tell and will be a great talker around the campfire. "They've been desperate...

item.title: Rita Simons to star in production of The House On Cold Hill - Independent.ie
item.description:
Rita Simons to star in production of The House On Cold Hill  Independent.ie

Former EastEnder Rita Simons is set to star on stage in Peter James’ The House On Cold Hill. The actress, best known for playing Albert Square’s Roxy, will be joined by Holby City’s Joe McFadden and fellow EastEnder Charlie Clements in the play, which starts next year. Hollyoaks’ Persephone Swales-Dawson has also joined the production. Joe McFadden (PA) The ghostly mystery is based on James’ 2015 book. It follows the Harcourt family – Ollie (McFadden), Caro (Simons) and their daughter Jade (Swales-Dawson) – as they move into the house of their dreams, which has been empty for the last 40 ye...

item.title: Barbara Windsor recovering 'really well' after surgery - RTÉ News
item.description:
Barbara Windsor recovering 'really well' after surgery  RTÉ News

Barbara Windsor is recovering "really well" after undergoing heart surgery, her husband has said. The former EastEnders star had a pacemaker fitted following complications with the medication she has been taking for Alzheimer's. Windsor's husband, Scott Mitchell, told The Sun that she is now recuperating at home, saying: "Barbara was suffering from a low heart rate which doctors thought was being caused by some of her medication. "She was getting very dizzy and short of breath and fainted one day at home, so she had an eight-day hospital spell about four weeks ago and they’ve put in a pacem...
